title: What is the longest recorded coma where the person woke up and was not brain dead? - Quora

response.answer_text: I Def do Not think Mine was a 'record’ of any sorts: Hwvr I was comatose for around ~28 days, hard to say exactly how long it as it would be ~90 days before I’d Walk out of the hospital. October 21, 2007 Accident date: ~November 17th, 2007 ~up from coma January 4th, 2008 ~walked out of the hospital: WITH ASSISTANCE!! Dates of (Up from Coma) approximated. Jan 4th tho: That’s when I Actually ~Walked Out of the hospital!! I Say ~(Kinda) Bc I have ZERO memory of this! Hwvr, my Friends/Family kept a Photoblog-Journal of my accident in order to Document said events. Unfortunately the Blog has since gone down. There ARE Remanence of it: Mike Rosner’s Blog for Family & Friends also: Mike Rosner’s Blog for Family & Friends Actually seems like These Two links Might be the same/ if they are, I apologize. I honestly don’t remember much of those early day/ Soo fortunate to HAVE the friends AND Family Willing to put in Those EXTRA Hours/Days/WEEKS/MONTHS AND YEARS Now!!! Esp. Now that the Blog's down, and I’d been focused on Living LIFE now. Blessed, utterly OhSo blessed and Eternally grateful!!

Some politicians have been in office for more than 25 years, but, since you qualified as ‘not brain dead’, I guess that won’t do. There was a movie about this, a number of years ago, that was based on truth (of course they hyped it up a bit for the movie). I don’t remember it’s name, but basically a person went into a ‘persistent vegetative state’ not due to brain trauma and survived for many years. An experimental drug was tried and the patient awakened and was “OK”. But the effect was not sustained. They relapsed, and later died. Since then I have read of a few other similar events. A key condition is that the cause of the coma is not be due brain damage, but dysfunction of the brain’s arousal center.
